intro: Pedicularis tricolor, commonly known as the three-color lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its strikingly colorful flowers, which typically display red, yellow, and white petals in a single bloom. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a subject of interest in both botany and horticulture.
